business.headline: Health insurance: 4 tips to reduce premiums for senior citizens Purchasing a health insurance policy at a younger age can help in securing reduced premium rates. Generally, lower insurance premiums are offered to younger people as they are considered low risk.

Index Funds vs. ETFs: 5 key things every investor should know Exchange-Traded Funds are traded like shares on the stock market and can be sold or purchased at existing market prices during the day, while Index Funds are traded only once at the closure of the share market.

ICMAI demands 'accountant' status for cost accountants in new Income Tax BillIn its memorandum, ICMAI highlighted the extensive training of Cost and Management Accountants (CMAs), which includes expertise in taxation, finance, auditing, corporate laws, and strategic risk management.

New tax regime: 3 deductions that can help taxpayers maximise savings  Though the new regime offered concessional tax rates, it reduced several popular deductions and exemptions, like HRA, LTA, interest on home loans, Section 80C, and more.

AI to take centre stage at the 3rd Digital News Publishers Association ConclaveThrough various keynote sessions, panel discussions and expert presentations, this year's DNPA Conclave aims to decode various critical issues, future strategies, opportunities and models that can power an equitable, inclusive and sustainable digital media ecosystem in an era of rapid technological advancement.
AMFI launches Chhoti SIP, Tarun Yojana, and MITRA. All you need to knowThe latest initiative by AMFI reinforces its goal of making mutual fund investments accessible to all investors across India.

Sensex, Nifty end lower for another session; auto stocks tumbleThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 424.90 points to 75,311.06 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 117.25 points to settle at 22,795.90.

Explained: What are 'high-conviction stocks' and why investors should track themHigh-conviction stocks are shares that investors, analysts, or fund managers strongly believe will deliver higher-than-average returns.

8th Pay Commission: When will it be formed? A look at the past trendsA Pay Commission recommends changes to the salary structure, allowances and benefits to be offered to employees depending upon the prevailing economic structure.

Explained: Why M&M share price tumbled 6% todayThe stock tumbled after the company said it will put money into a rights issue for its two subsidiaries—Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services (MMFSL) and Mahindra Lifespace Developers (MLDL).

Worried about volatile stock market? Check these 10 potential multibagger stocksThe most important factor for determining multibagger stocks is to check earnings and growth potential. Investors should seek stocks that consistently deliver revenue and profit, check metrics like PE ratio and dividend yield, and compare their performance with sectoral or broader market trends.

Planning to start SIP? 2 reasons why you should consider NPSBy investing in NPS, individuals can claim tax benefits of up to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C and an additional Rs 50,000 under Section 80CCD (1B).

Explained: Why Religare Enterprises share price jumped up to 9% today Soon after the announcement, Religare's stock price climbed 8.52% to hit Rs 242 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. At around 11:24 am, shares of the company were trading 2.31% higher at Rs 228.15.

India may let foreign EV makers like Tesla test market before investing: ReportThe government may let foreign electric vehicle makers like Tesla sell cars first and invest later, with final SMEC guidelines expected soon to kickstart local manufacturing incentives.

Sensex tanks nearly 500 points. 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 461.08 points to 75,274.88 at 11:32 am and the NSE Nifty50 fell 144.45 points to trade at 22,768.70. Here are 3 things investors need to know about today's stock market downturn.

Sensex, Nifty fall as FII selling, Trump's tariff threat batter D-StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 272.61 points to 75,463.64 at around 9:51 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 91.80 points to 22,821.35.

PNB revises interest rates. Check new home, car and personal loan rates There will be zero processing fees and documentation charges on most of PNB's home loan schemes till March 31, 2025, thereby making housing loans more affordable and more accessible.
LIC Smart Pension Plan: Check eligibility and other details The Smart Pension Plan requires a minimum investment of Rs 1,00,000, while there is no cap on the maximum purchase limit.

Tesla set for India entry with first EV shipment in coming months: Report The US carmaker plans to start selling these cars in the three major cities of Mumbai, Delhi, and Bangalore around the third quarter of the year, say reports.

Sensex ends 200 points lower, Nifty below 23,000; HDFC falls over 2%Stock market closing today: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 203.22 points lower at 75,735.96, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 19.75 points to settle at 22,913.15.

Will Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs hurt Indian rupee? It may be noted that India was the 10th biggest exporter to the US in 2024, and higher tariffs might make it tougher for Indian businesses to sell their goods there.

Can employers deny gratuity in any situation? Here's all you need to knowWith the latest ruling, the Supreme Court has stated that if an employer dismisses an employee on grounds of moral turpitude, his gratuity can be forfeited without waiting for a court's verdict.

FIIs continue to dump Indian stocks: Which stocks are feeling the heat? Data from National Securities Depository Limited (NSDL) showed that FPIs have dumped $3.5 billion worth of financial stocks in 2025 so far, accounting for 31% of their total sales of $11.45 billion as of February 14.

RBI may allow some depositors of New India Co-op Bank to withdraw funds: Report Last week, the RBI took strict action against New India Co-operative bank by suspending deposit withdrawals for six months, stopping the issuance of new loans, and appointing an administrator.

Uday Kotak explains how FIIs are gaining at the expense of domestic investorsUday Kotak said that FIIs are benefiting from the investments made by domestic retail investors, who are continuously putting money into the stock market.

Google Pay begins charging for bill payments. Here's what users need to knowThis is not the first time Google Pay has announced the imposition of fees. Last year, it levied Rs 3 convenience fee for mobile recharges.

Indian exporters aren't losing sleep over Donald Trump's tariff threat. Here's whyIndustry executives say US tariff hikes on autos and pharmaceuticals won't hurt Indian exporters much, as competitors from other countries will face the same impact.

Will tax cuts for middle class in budget help boost consumption? RBI says this The RBI bulletin pointed out that the government has given a Rs 1 lakh crore tax break to the middle class, which should leave more money in their pockets.

Dalal Street carnage: Top market investors lose over Rs 80,000 croreThe recent stock market downturn has wiped out over Rs 80,000 crore from the portfolios of some of India's most renowned investors, such as Radhakishan Damani and the Jhunjhunwala family.

EPFO to roll out UPI-based EPF claim withdrawals within 3 months. Check detailsOnce integrated, claim amounts can be easily accessed by the subscribers via digital wallets, mention sources. This would minimise the processing time and lead to an enhanced user-friendly experience.

Is India's economy set for a strong recovery? Here's what RBI saysThe government's push on capital spending, MSMEs, agriculture, and exports is expected to help the economy in the long run while keeping the fiscal deficit in check. A recent repo rate cut might also support domestic demand.

Why shares of cigarette makers ITC, Godfrey Phillips are falling today?ITC's share price was trading 1.44% lower at Rs 400.65 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:06 am. Godfrey Phillips shares were down 4.58% to Rs 6,260 and VST Industries stock was down 3% to Rs 290.65.

Why NPS is better than EPF for tax saving under new tax regimeNPS vs EPF: In the case of EPF, employee contributions generally qualify for a deduction under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act, capped at Rs 1.5 lakh annually, under the Old Income Tax regime.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as FMCG, banking stocks drag marketThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 233.22 points to 75,705.96, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 75.05 points to 22,857.85 as of 9:38 AM.

Cigarette prices set to rise? Government may hike GST on tobacco productsCurrently, cigarettes and other tobacco products attract a GST of 28% along with various other levies, taking the total tax burden to 53%.

Dalal Street's losing streak: Why the market fall may not end soonStock Market: The earnings growth of Nifty50 companies was 5% in the October-December quarter, marking the third straight quarter of single-digit growth, which is a sharp contrast to the double-digit profit growth seen in the previous two years.
Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower in volatile session; small and midcaps gainThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 28.21 points lower at 75,939.18, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 12.40 points lower at 22,932.90.

FIIs continue to dump Indian stocks: What it means for your investment portfolioWith FIIs selling aggressively, smallcaps and midcaps bleeding, and China attracting inflows, here's what retail investors should do.

Tesla likely to set up shop in India, may invest $3-5 billion: Sources During their visit, Tesla executives are expected to hold meetings with officials from the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) and other key ministries.
Small SIP, big returns: Check how Rs 250 a month can grow to Rs 17 lakhSBI Mutual Fund's new JanNivesh SIP is making investing more accessible, letting anyone start with as little as Rs 250 a month.

entertainment.headline: 'Mismatched' actor Prajakta Koli shares dreamy pics from her mehndiContent creator and actor Prajakta Koli has started her pre-wedding celebrations with a vibrant mehndi ceremony. She shared joyful moments with her fiance Vrishank Khanal and family on social media.

Honey Singh's Millionaire concert in Mumbai showed what grand comebacks look likeYo Yo Honey Singh made a powerful return to the stage in Mumbai, captivating fans with his energy and heartfelt messages. His performance was a testament to his resilience and dedication to the art.

Samay Raina recalls what he asked Tanmay Bhat after India's Got Latent controversyComedian Samay Raina addresses the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's inappropriate remark on his show, India's Got Latent, during his tour in Canada. He recalled what he had asked Tanmay Bhat after the controversy erupted.
Honey Singh's jibe at Raftaar, Badshah: People say they'll write my destinyHoney Singh took a direct dig at fellow artists Badshah and Raftaar at the first Millionaire India Tour stop in Mumbai.

Watch: Honey Singh's take on Diljit Dosanjh's 'Punjabi Aa Gaya Oye'Honey Singh launched his Millionaire India Tour in Mumbai, delivering a captivating performance that engaged a sold-out audience. He shared his take on Diljit Dosanjh's 'Punjabi aa gays oye', emphasising unity among diverse Indian communities.

Watch: Honey Singh kicks off Millionaire tour with a grand Mumbai showRapper Honey Singh launched his Millionaire Tour with a spectacular concert in Mumbai. The show featured dramatic entrances and a lineup of energetic performances.

Undercover High School X review: Fans give thumbs up to Seo Kang-joon's K-dramaUndercover High School, featuring Seo Kang-joon and Jin Ki-joo, has premiered on MBC TV. The series, praised for its engaging storyline, follows an undercover NIS agent as a high school student.

Rapper Diddy's attorney withdraws from case: Under no circumstances can I continueAnthony Ricco, representing Sean 'Diddy' Combs, has filed to withdraw from the federal case citing reasons protected by attorney-client privilege. Ricco had once defended Osama bin Laden.

Buried Hearts review: Park Hyung-sik commands attention in his darkest roleReleased-Sat Feb 22, 2025The Korean drama Buried Hearts will captivate viewers with its blend of intense emotions and high-stakes drama. The series, featuring Park Hyung-sik, explores the complex dynamics of corporate intrigue and personal survival. Read the full review.

Rakhi Sawant reacts to summons: I'm poor, not criminal - focus on rape casesRakhi Sawant was summoned by the Maharashtra cyber cell to record her statement regarding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's controversial remarks on Samay Raina's show, 'India's Got Latent'. She urged the police to focus on solving pending rape cases instead of treating her like a criminal.

Zero Day: Critics praise Robert De Niro, criticise show's 'incoherent politics'Critics have mixed reactions to Robert De Niro's latest Netflix series, Zero Day. While many have praised De Niro, a section of them are unhappy with the narrative of the show.

Grammy-nominated band OneRepublic unites with Karan Aujla for new song Tell MeGlobal pop-rock sensation OneRepublic is collaborating with Punjabi artist Karan Aujla for a new track titled Tell Me. It will release on February 27.

general news.headline: Friedrich Merz headed to be German Chancellor, Olaf Scholz concedes poll defeatGermany's election results signal a political shift, with the CDU/CSU bloc winning and Friedrich Merz poised to lead. The far-right AfD secured its best result, while the SPD suffered a historic defeat. Coalition talks will be complex, delaying economic and policy decisions.

Delhi-bound American Airlines flight diverted to Rome after bomb threatAn American Airlines flight from New York to Delhi was rerouted to Rome following a bomb threat received via email. Authorities are conducting security checks before clearing it for departure.

12 Indians deported to Panama from US arrive in Delhi, 4 of them from PunjabFirst batch of 12 deported Indian nationals from Panama landed in New Delhi amid the US immigration crackdown. Four of the deportees were from Punjab and three each from Haryana and Uttar Pradesh.

Zelenskyy 'ready' to step down as President in exchange for Ukraine joining NatoPresident Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he is willing to step down 'immediately' if it secures Nato membership for Ukraine, urging Trump to provide security to his country against Russia's full-blown invasion.

After Shivraj Chouhan, Punjab BJP chief flags broken IndiGo seats, airline reactsAfter Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan flagged a broken seat allotted to him on his Bhopal-Delhi Air India flight, Punjab BJP chief Sunil Jakhar shared pictures of broken seats on the Chandigarh-Delhi flight.

Available for Congress but have options if party doesn't need me: Shashi TharoorAmid a row over his remarks praising PM Narendra Modi and the LDF government in Kerala, senior Congress MP Shashi Tharoor described himself as an accessible leader, but asserted he had "options" if the party didn't want to utilise his services.

USAID funded 7 projects in India in 2023-24, unrelated to 'voter turnout': CentreThe USAID funded seven projects in India worth USD 750 million in India in FY 2023-24, but none of these were related to enhancing voter turnout in the country, as per a latest annual report of the Finance Ministry.

Overwhelmed, yet why railways won't restrict unreserved travelWhy does railways sell many more tickets than there is space? The answer: social duty, complex logistics and low-income travellers who don't seem to complain

LPU's 2025 Batch Final Year Student Bags Rs 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) Placement Package-Betireddy Naga Vamsi Reddy B. Tech student has secured a 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) package with an AI robotics company and is set to graduate in May 2025. 

-Over 1,700 students have received packages ranging from Rs 10 LPA – Rs 1 Crore per annum 

-1,912 students received multiple job offers while Adireddy Vasu, secured 7 job offers, setting a rare and impressive record.

Pak university criticised for show-cause notice to students for celebrating HoliLal Malhi, a former parliamentarian, posted on social media the notice issued to the students, most of them Hindus, by Dawood University of Engineering and Technology.

Man kills wife in Prayagraj hotel room, tells children she 'got lost' at KumbhA man from Delhi was arrested for his wife's murder. He took her to Prayagraj on the pretext of taking a holy dip at Maha Kumbh and killed her in a lodge room.

Bryan Johnson moves office into oxygen chamber, Internet asks 'Is that even safe?''Age-reversing' CEO Bryan Johnson has moved his office into his hyperbaric oxygen chamber. He shared a video of himself working on his laptop inside his chamber.

Muhammad Yunus invites Elon Musk to launch Starlink in Bangladesh in '90 days'Bangladesh's interim government chief adviser, Muhammad Yunus, has invited Elon Musk to Dhaka to launch Starlink, aiming to expand internet access for rural communities and youth.

PM Modi's 'slave mentality' dig at Opposition over remarks on Maha KumbhThe Prime Minister's remarks came days after West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee described Maha Kumbh as a 'Mrityu Kumbh' due to deaths caused in stampedes in Delhi and Prayagraj, alleging that authorities were suppressing the actual death toll.

Elderly Australian man's wish to be buried in India gets fulfilledA 91-year-old man from Australia's Sydney died due to age-related illness while travelling on a cruise ship from Kolkata to Patna. His last wish was to get buried in an Indian cemetery after his death, and he had a love for India.

An evening in Paris and an enigma called Pakistan sportsPakistan, a nation of 250 million, sent seven athletes to the 2024 Paris Olympics. One returned with a historic gold. Pakistan's sporting story is one of rare brilliance against systemic decay. Much like its cricket, Pakistan thrives on flashes of individual genius while institutions crumble around it.

Russia's largest drone attack on Ukraine day before war's 3rd anniversaryUkraine's air force said in a statement that 138 of the drones were downed and another 119 disappeared from radars after being jammed by electronic warfare, adding that Russia also launched three ballistic missiles.

Gujarat man promised Canadian visa by nephew, loses Rs 2.7 crore in fake scamDarshan Patel alleged that he had to give money to his nephew Dhruv on different occasions, first on the pretext of a visitor visa, then for a work permit, and then for a business visa.
Bride pride: How to get glowing skin for the big dayExpert-backed techniques to correct most skin imperfections and get that picture-perfect wedding look

When Trump, Meloni, Modi talk, it's threat to democracy: Italy PM bashes 'liberals'Meloni said the world no longer believes in the left wing's lies, and that they are used to the motivated criticism of nationalist leaders.

Atishi appointed Leader of Opposition in Delhi Assembly, 1st woman to hold postAtishi, former Chief Minister and AAP leader, was chosen by the party's MLAs as the Leader of Opposition in the Delhi Assembly. She is the first woman to become the Leader of Opposition in the Assembly.

No death certificate from Kolkata civic body yet, claim RG Kar victim's parentsThe parents of the Kolkata trainee doctor, who was raped and murdered at RG Kar hospital in August last year, have alleged that the Kolkata Municipal Corporation haven't issued her death certificate yet.

sports.headline: India beating Pakistan in Pakistan? Shreyas Iyer's classy reply to journalistIndia batter Shreyas Iyer gave a classy reply to a clever question by a Pakistani journalist after India's win over Pakistan in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. India beat Pakistan by six wickets in the highly-anticipated clash.

It's over: Rizwan accepts Pakistan's fate in Champions TrophyChampions Trophy 2025: In the post-match press conference, Mohammad Rizwan accepted that Pakistan's journey in the tournament is as good as over. On Sunday, Pakistan slumped to back-to-back losses after India beat them by six wickets.

Hosts out in 5 days: Pakistan trolled after embarrassing loss to IndiaThe Pakistan cricket team was massively trolled after their embarrassing loss to India in the Champions Trophy on Sunday, February 23. Pakistan have now lost 2 in 2 and face early exit from the competition.

Virat Kohli's 100 vs Pakistan was not a surprise: Rohit SharmaIndia vs Pakistan, Champions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli proved naysayers wrong with a masterful 100 in India's six-wicket win in Dubai on Sunday. Rohit Sharma said the dressing room had no doubt about Kohli returning to form.

New Zealand are coming into the game having beaten Pakistan while Bangladesh lost against India in their first game.

NZ vs BAN: New Zealand captain Mitchell Santner happy to see batters in formNew Zealand captain Mitchell Santner is happy to see his batting order be in form ahead of their match against Bangladesh in the Champions Trophy on February 24. New Zealand batters are in form as they defeated Pakistan in their opening match.

Virat Kohli faster than Tendulkar, Sangakkara to 14000 ODI runsStar India batter Virat Kohli broke Sachin Tendulkar's record to become the fastest to 14,000 runs in ODIs. Kohli achieved the landmark during India vs Pakistan match in the Champions Trophy 2025.

Rohit suffers injury scare, struggles to move freely on fieldChampions Trophy 2025: Captain Rohit Sharma struggled with an apparent hamstring injury during the Pakistan innings on Sunday in Dubai. Rohit avoided fielding in busy areas after receiving treatment from the medical team.

Sarfaraz Ahmed on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's future: Let them play and decideFormer Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said that India batting stalwarts Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should be given the freedom to decide their future.

New Zealand not taking Bangladesh lightly despite Shakib absence: SantnerNew Zealand captain Mitchell Santner has claimed that they won't be taking Bangladesh lightly despite the absence of Shakib Al Hasan in the lineup. Shakib failed to make it to the Champions Trophy squad.
MS Dhoni spotted watching IND vs PAK game wearing CSK jerseyFormer India captain MS Dhoni was seen watching the India vs Pakistan match in the Champions Trophy 2025 with Bollywood actor Sunny Deol.

80 dots in 20 overs: Meme fest as fans slam slow Rizwan knock India vs Pakistan, Champions Trophy 2025: Mohammad Rizwan was slammed by a section of fans after the Pakistan captain struggled for fluency in the middle-overs in Dubai. Pakistan played 80 dot balls in the first 20 overs of their innings.

Did RCB troll Babar? IPL team's special emoji for PAK batterChampions Trophy: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) dropped a tweet, using a bell emoji after Babar Azam got out to Hardik Pandya in the match against India at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Rohit Sharma's family proudly cheers for India captain in Pakistan clashChampions Trophy 2025: Rohit Sharma's wife Ritika Sajdeh and their daughter Samaira cheered enthusiastically for Team India in their clash against Mohammad Rizwan's Pakistan in Dubai.

Hardik Pandya hits 'Bye Bye' send off to Babar after dismissalHardik Pandya dismissed Babar Azam for 23 in India's Champions Trophy clash against Pakistan. The all-rounder gave a cheeky send-off after the Pakistan star batter edged a catch to KL Rahul following a boundary off the previous ball.

Cricket visas and when India's victory in Pakistan was foretoldThough the Indian side and fans couldn't travel to Pakistan for the Champions Trophy due to security reasons, in 2004, thousands travelled there on cricket visas. Here's what made the 2004 India tour of Pakistan historic. A little-known match played before the third and crucial Rawalpindi Test would go on to predict its outcome.

IND vs PAK: Mohammed Shami suffers injury scare, Indian staff looks concernedIndia pacer Mohammed Shami suffered a major injury concern while bowling against Pakistan in Dubai on Sunday, February 23. Shami suffered an issue in his ankle mid-way through his 3rd over.

Jasprit Bumrah receives ICC awards from Jay Shah in Dubai before IND vs PAKChampions Trophy 2025: After receiving his ICC Awards from president Jay Shah, Jasprit Bumrah met and greeted his teammates in Dubai. Bumrah's presence lifted the Indian team ahead of their big game against Pakistan on Sunday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.
